intro: Hedypnois scabra, commonly known as the rough hedypnois, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Hedypnois scabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
